result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A. Felicelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven A. Felicelli is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven A. Felicelli was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.      ** Pay fine of $200.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A. Felicelli

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:48am-  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions.  13 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court orders $200.00 fine plus costs, drug surcharge & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
from P&P Agent Kori Merrill w/ letter from Tony C Moore, Executive Director of Birds of a Feather Inc, attached
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:10pm-  Amended information filed.  DE acknowledges receipt & waives reading.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to amended count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 2 is dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.
from CSA Attorney Lori Thoennes withdrawing request for lien on bond money

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:49pm-  Matter heard with co-defendant's case.  State is attempting to resolve matter globally.  Court adjourns matter to June 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Bond continued.

And Order for lien on bond. -   Attorney Iverson - child support agency
The bond money in this case shall be applied to the deft/respondent's child support obligation in Kenosha Co.

Defendant, Steven A. Felicelli, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time to work on a resolution.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:42pm-  Matter heard with co-defendant's case.  For reasons set forth on the record, Court adjourns matter to February 20, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:57am-  Matter heard with co-defendant's case.  Attorney Rose is unable to appear today as he is in trial in another court.  Court adjourns matter to December 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Bond continued.
